data.title: Watch Bill Murray Croon “Smoke on the Water” at Comic-Con
data.meta_description: The star of the upcoming Rock the Kasbah showed up in character and singing.
data.text:
Bill Murray certainly used his position as one of the most beloved actors in film to kick off San Diego Comic-Con, with a bang, as he showed up to his panel for Rock the Kasbah in character and singing Deep Purple’s “Smoke on the Water.”

Written and produced by Murray’s long-time friend and collaborator Mitch Glazer and directed by Barry Levinson, Kasbah features Murray as a rock tour manager who finds himself stranded in Afghanistan (along with a tightly wound Bruce Willis) after his star act (Zooey Deschanel) ditches him.

Strutting up to the stage through the audience, Murray began belting out the heavy rock standard much as he does in [the film’s trailer] (https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=102&v=4PKOefvGpNE).

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Moments later, Murray asked the audience to sing 30 seconds worth of a song, any song, of their own choosing, basking in the cacophony.

The vice president has inherited her boss’s sprawling 1,300-person campaign apparatus. Some insiders are worried that Harris needs stronger allies. “She basically has Biden’s team right now,” one says. “She needs some people in that room who are her people.”
